posts.body:
>>f043b913-c7db-4fab-bd09-64f90cecbb52
>>4e3c5b2e-d259-4d65-b663-a8e5284754c3

There may be people spying on us, but the fact remains that everything that we see on this site is loaded from your local machine. In that case, enable TOR for all connections and if you want to be even safer, use the TOR Browser Bundle and you should be pretty safe.

Also, enable the "Help distribute new files" option for this site if at all possible to make it easier for everyone.

>>8ea1242f-ef22-4efb-b21a-e3738f026abf

If you have it set to help distribute new files, it's constantly downloading new files for the site and eventually purging old files, so that "signature" will be constantly changing.

Also, every time you restart 0net, the TOR circuit changes, so that provides you with an additional level of privacy/anonymity.

>>fb7befca-c6cc-4306-a919-17c583de5262

Click on the board ID on the main page and it'll mute and delete content from that board.

It's a little pricey, but ProtonVPN is great. You can select the servers and a few of them give you direct connection to the TOR network as well without having to run your own node.

They use OpenVPN and you can download the connection profiles to run using the regular OpenVPN client or from your router instead of their software if you want.
